question_stem:
3.
(10 points) Consider a dataset about female horseshoe crabs during their mating
season. Researchers want to investigate the male crabs that group around the female and
potentially fertilize her eggs (called satellites). The table below gives the description for
each variable in this study.
The (cid:28)rst ten rows of the dataset is given in Figure 1.

Variable Description
satell
color
weight

1 = female crab has satellite(s), 0 = not having any satellites
female crab’s color
female crab weight (kg)

Figure 1: The (cid:28)rst 10 rows of the dataset

A model was (cid:28)tted for the dataset given, called model M. The summary output for model
M is given in Figure 2.

4

 DSA1101

Figure 2: Summary output of model M

Note: For the questions that follow, report numerical answers to three signi(cid:28)cant (cid:28)gures
if they are smaller than one and to three decimal places if they are larger than one.

items.part_stem:
(a) Type the equation of model M into the R code (cid:28)le as comments. Explain in detail if

any notation is used in the equation.

(a) Type the equation of model M into the R code (cid:28)le as comments. Explain in detail if

any notation is used in the equation.

items.part_stem: (b) Report the coe(cid:30)cient of variable color in model M and interpret it.
items.part_stem_html: (b) Report the coe(cid:30)cient of variable color in model M and interpret it.

items.part_stem:
(c) Report the coe(cid:30)cient of variable weight in model M and interpret it. Is it signi(cid:28)cant

in model M? Explain.

in model M? Explain.

items.part_stem:
(d) Calculate and report the odds ratio of having satellites between two crabs below:

Crab A: weight = 3 kg, color = light;

Crab B: weight = 2 kg, color = dark.

5
